segments.header: Nonparametric Bootstrap Methods in Risk Analysis
segments.content: Nonparametric bootstrap statistics is an algorithmic approach that typically employs a simple random sample with replacement (srswr) scheme. In the capital asset pricing model (capm), the underlying distribution is often assumed to be gaussian, which is not accurate.

segments.header: Comparing of Two Passive Investment Strategies
segments.content: In section (2), we demonstrated that the indian stock market based on the nifty50 index is not efficient. So it raises the question how it affects the risk profile of the passive strategy (i.e., portfolio weight) to check this question, we decided to consider three different portfolios.

If we want to be passive investors, we should follow an equal-weight portfolio strategy instead of investing in exchange traded fund like netf, which mimics the nifty50. We found that the equal weight portfolio has a uniformly lower risk than the nifty 50 portfolio before and during the russia-ukraine war.
